alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued October 17 at 4:37PM PDT until October 18 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Very high threat of sneaker waves along the coast. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Waves will run up significantly farther on a beach than normal, including over rocks and jetties. These sneaker waves can suddenly knock people off of their feet and quickly pull them into the cold ocean waters, resulting in serious injury or death. Waves may also lift driftwood logs, trapping anyone caught underneath. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Elevated threat of sneaker waves will begin late tonight and continue through Wednesday as very long period and energetic swell arrives from a distant Pacific storm.
info.instruction: Avoid climbing on rocks and jetties. Stay away from the ocean and remain out of the water to avoid hazardous conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
